info.title: Installinator API
info.description: API for installinator to fetch artifacts and report progress

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: The kind of artifact this is.

post.summary: Report progress and completion to the server.
post.description: This method requires an `update_id` path parameter. This update ID is matched against the server currently performing an update. If the server is unaware of the update ID, it will return an HTTP 422 Unprocessable Entity code.

parameters.name: update_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the update.

EventReportForInstallinatorSpec.description:
A report produced from an [`EventBuffer`](crate::EventBuffer).

Remote reports can be passed into a [`StepContext`](crate::StepContext), in which case they show up as nested events.

last_seen.description:
The last event seen.

`last_seen` can be used to retrieve deltas of events.

progress_events.description:
A list of progress events, or whether we're currently waiting for a progress event.

Currently, this produces one progress event for each top-level and nested event in progress.

root_execution_id.description:
The root execution ID for this report.

Each report has a root execution ID, which ties together all step and progress events. This is always filled out if the list of step events is non-empty.

step_events.description:
A list of step events.

Step events include success and failure events.

zones_to_install.description: Number of zone images that will be installed.

address.description: The address the artifact was downloaded from.

output.description: The output of the write operation.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.
The installinator document.
The host phase 2 component.
The control plane component.
A component that means "both the host and the control plane", used for writes for now. It is possible that this component will go away in the future.
Future variants that might be unknown.

peer.description:
The peer being downloaded from.

Available with downlad events.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.

destination.description:
The destination being formatted or written to.

Available with format and destination events.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.

M2Slot.description: Describes an M.2 slot, often in the context of writing a system image to it.

ProgressCounter.description:
Current progress.

Both `current` and `total` are abstract counters. These counters are often a number of bytes. There is no guarantee that the counter won't go back in subsequent events; that can happen e.g. if a fetch happens from multiple peers within a single attempt.

data.description: The kind of event this is.

spec.description:
The specification that this event belongs to.

This is typically the name of the type `S` for which `StepSpec` is implemented.

This can be used with `Self::from_generic` to deserialize generic metadata.

total_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of execution.

data.description: The kind of event this is.

spec.description:
The specification that this event belongs to.

This is typically the name of the type `S` for which `StepSpec` is implemented.

This can be used with `Self::from_generic` to deserialize generic metadata.

total_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of execution.

oneOf.description:
The update engine is waiting for a progress message.

The update engine sends this message immediately after a [`StepEvent`] corresponding to a new step.

attempt.description: The attempt number currently being executed.

attempt_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the attempt.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

attempt.description: The attempt number currently being executed.

attempt_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the attempt.

metadata.description: Metadata that was returned with progress.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

attempt.description: The attempt number currently being executed.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.

The update engine is waiting for a progress message.

The update engine sends this message immediately after a [`StepEvent`] corresponding to a new step.

attempt.description: The attempt number currently being executed.

attempt_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the attempt.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

attempt_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the attempt.

metadata.description: Metadata that was returned with progress.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.

total_component_steps.description: The number of steps present in this component.
The number of steps present in this component.

data.description: The kind of event this is.

event_index.description: A monotonically increasing index for this `StepEvent`.

spec.description:
The specification that this event belongs to.

This is typically the name of the type `S` for which `StepSpec` is implemented.

This can be used along with `Self::from_generic` to identify which specification to deserialize generic metadata against. For example:

```rust,ignore if event.spec == "MySpec" { // event is likely generated from a MySpec engine. let event = Event::<MySpec>::from_generic(event)?; // ... } ```

total_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of execution.

data.description: The kind of event this is.

event_index.description: A monotonically increasing index for this `StepEvent`.

spec.description:
The specification that this event belongs to.

This is typically the name of the type `S` for which `StepSpec` is implemented.

This can be used along with `Self::from_generic` to identify which specification to deserialize generic metadata against. For example:

```rust,ignore if event.spec == "MySpec" { // event is likely generated from a MySpec engine. let event = Event::<MySpec>::from_generic(event)?; // ... } ```

total_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of execution.

oneOf.description:
No steps were defined, and the executor exited without doing anything.

This is a terminal event: it is guaranteed that no more events will be seen after this one.

Execution was started.

This is an initial event -- it is always expected to be the first event received from the event stream.

components.description: A list of components, along with the number of items each component has.

steps.description: The list of steps that will be executed.

oneOf.description: Progress was reset along an attempt, and this attempt is going down a different path.

attempt_elapsed.description: The amount of time this attempt has taken so far.

message.description: A message assocaited with the reset.

metadata.description: Progress-related metadata associated with this attempt.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: An attempt failed and this step is being retried.

attempt_elapsed.description: The amount of time the previous attempt took.

message.description: A message associated with the retry.

next_attempt.description: The attempt number for the next attempt.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: A step is complete and the next step has been started.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

next_step.description: The next step that is being started.

step.description: Information about the step that just completed.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description:
Execution is complete.

This is a terminal event: it is guaranteed that no more events will be seen after this one.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

last_outcome.description: The outcome of the last step.

last_step.description: Information about the last step that completed.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description:
Execution failed.

This is a terminal event: it is guaranteed that no more events will be seen after this one.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

causes.description: A chain of causes associated with the failure.

failed_step.description: Information about the step that failed.

message.description: A message associated with the failure.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

total_attempts.description: The total number of attempts that were performed before the step failed.

oneOf.description:
Execution aborted by an external user.

This is a terminal event: it is guaranteed that no more events will be seen after this one.

aborted_step.description: Information about the step that was running at the time execution was aborted.

attempt.description: The attempt that was running at the time the step was aborted.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

message.description: A message associated with the abort.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: A nested step event occurred.

attempt_elapsed.description: The time it took for this attempt to complete.

step.description: Information about the step that's occurring.

step_elapsed.description: Total time elapsed since the start of the step. Includes prior attempts.

oneOf.description: Future variants that might be unknown.

No steps were defined, and the executor exited without doing anything.

This is a terminal event: it is guaranteed that no more events will be seen after this one.

Execution was started.

This is an initial event -- it is always expected to be the first event received from the event stream.

component.description: The component that this step is part of.

index.description: The index of the step within all steps to be executed.

total_component_steps.description: The total number of steps in this component.

component_index.description: The index of the step within the component.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with this step.
Additional metadata associated with this step.

oneOf.description: The step completed successfully.

message.description: An optional message associated with this step.

metadata.description: Optional completion metadata associated with the step.

oneOf.description: The step completed with a warning.

metadata.description: Optional completion metadata associated with the step.

oneOf.description: The step was skipped with a message.

WriteOutput.description:
The output of a write operation.

Forms part of [`InstallinatorCompletionMetadata::Write`].

slots_attempted.description: The slots that were requested to be written.

slots_written.description: The slots that were actually written.
